name: different
trans: Not the same as something or someone else.

sentences.english: The place looks completely different now.
sentences.chinese: 这地方现在完全变了。

sentences.english: They decided to try a radically different approach.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定尝试一种全然不同的办法。

sentences.english: We found women had significantly different political views from men.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现女性的政治观点与男性大不相同。

sentences.english: a slightly different way of doing things
sentences.chinese: 稍有区别的做事方法

sentences.english: What actually happened was subtly different from the PR people’s version.
sentences.chinese: 实际情况与公关部那些人的说法有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The show is refreshingly different from most exhibitions of modern art.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览与大多数现代艺术展不一样，令人耳目一新。

sentences.english: The publishing business is no different from any other business in this respect.
sentences.chinese: 从这一点来讲，出版业和其他任何行业没有什么差别。

sentences.english: It’s a different world here in London.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦这儿的情况完全不同。

detailed_translations.english: not like something or someone else, or not like before

name: used
trans: Previously owned or operated by someone.

sentences.english: I do the dishes every day, so I’m used to it.
sentences.chinese: 我每天洗盘子，所以习惯了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 习惯的；二手的，使用过的
用（use的过去式）；（used to）过去常做

name: important
trans: Having great significance or value.

sentences.english: a very important meeting
sentences.chinese: 很重要的会议

sentences.english: The accident taught him an important lesson.
sentences.chinese: 那次事故给了他很大的教训。

sentences.english: Happiness is more important than money.
sentences.chinese: 快乐比金钱更重要。

sentences.english: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Oh, nothing important.’
sentences.chinese: “你说什么？”“噢，没什么大事。”

sentences.english: It’s vitally important that you understand the danger.
sentences.chinese: 了解危险所在是极为重要的。

sentences.english: a very important customer
sentences.chinese: 一位大客户

detailed_translations.english: an important event, decision, problem etc has a big effect or influence on people’s lives or on events in the future

name: every
trans: Happening or occurring each time.

sentences.english: His every utterance will be scrutinized.
sentences.chinese: 他说的每句话都会被细查。

sentences.english: She knows every student in the school.
sentences.chinese: 她认识学校里的每一个学生。

sentences.english: The buses go every 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车每隔10分钟发一班车。

detailed_translations.english: used with singular nouns to refer to all the members of a group of things or people

name: large
trans: Big in size or amount.

sentences.english: Los Angeles is the second largest city in the US.
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶是美国的第二大城市。

sentences.english: The T-shirt comes in Small, Medium and Large.
sentences.chinese: 这种T恤有小号、中号和大号。

sentences.english: a large ovenproof pan
sentences.chinese: 一只耐热的大烤盘

sentences.english: large sums ofmoney
sentences.chinese: 大笔的钱

sentences.english: those who drink large amounts of coffee
sentences.chinese: 咖啡喝得很多的人

sentences.english: A large number of students have signed up for the course.
sentences.chinese: 很多学生报名读这门课程。

detailed_translations.english: big in size, amount, or number

name: available
trans: Accessible and ready to be used.

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: popular
trans: Widely liked or admired by many people.

sentences.english: Hilary was popular at school.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里在学校里很受欢迎。

sentences.english: a popular holiday resort
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢的度假胜地

sentences.english: Coffee is probably the most popular drink in the world.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡很可能是世界上最受欢迎的饮料。

sentences.english: a popular movement for democracy
sentences.chinese: 争取民主的全民运动

detailed_translations.english: liked by a lot of people

name: able
trans: Having the skill or capability to do something.

sentences.english: I’ve always wanted to be able to speak Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 我一直想学会讲日语。

sentences.english: one of my more able students
sentences.chinese: 我班上能力比较强的学生之一

detailed_translations.english: to have the skill, strength, knowledge etc needed to do something

name: basic
trans: Fundamental or essential.

sentences.english: the basic principles of chemistry
sentences.chinese: 化学的基本原理

sentences.english: The basic idea is simple.
sentences.chinese: 基本思想很简单。

sentences.english: basic research
sentences.chinese: 基础研究

sentences.english: basic information
sentences.chinese: 基本信息

detailed_translations.english: forming the most important or most necessary part of something

name: known
trans: Familiar or recognized.

sentences.english: a study of all the known facts
sentences.chinese: 对所有已知事实的研究

sentences.english: her last known address
sentences.chinese: 她最后一个为人所知的地址

sentences.english: Apart from vaccines, there is no known way to protect against meningitis.
sentences.chinese: 除了使用疫苗外，还未发现其他预防脑膜炎的方法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 已知的；知名的；大家知道的
detailed_translations.english: used about something that people know about or have discovered

name: various
trans: Diverse or differing in various ways.

sentences.english: The jacket is available in various colours.
sentences.chinese: 这种夹克有好多种颜色可选。

sentences.english: There are various ways to answer your question.
sentences.chinese: 有多种方法可以回答你的问题。

sentences.english: He decided to leave school for various reasons.
sentences.chinese: 出于种种原因，他决定辍学。

detailed_translations.chinese: 各种各样的， 不同的
detailed_translations.english: if there are various things, there are several different types of that thing

name: difficult
trans: Requiring effort or skill to accomplish.

sentences.english: a difficult question
sentences.chinese: 难解的问题

sentences.english: an immensely difficult task
sentences.chinese: 极为艰巨的任务

sentences.english: Was the exam very difficult?
sentences.chinese: 这次考试很难吗？

sentences.english: It’s difficult to see how more savings can be made.
sentences.chinese: 想要进一步节约看来是很难了。

sentences.english: Don’t be so difficult!
sentences.chinese: 别这么挑剔！

detailed_translations.english: hard to do, understand, or deal with

name: several
trans: More than two but not many.

sentences.english: I have several suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个建议。

sentences.english: I have several methods.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个方法。

sentences.english: I have several reasons to support my view.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个理由来支持我的观点。

name: united
trans: Joined or combined into a single entity.

sentences.english: a united Europe
sentences.chinese: 统一的欧洲

sentences.english: The two countries were united against a common enemy.
sentences.chinese: 这两个国家联合起来对付共同的敌人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致的，统一的；团结的，和睦的
detailed_translations.english: joined or closely connected by feelings, aims etc

name: historical
trans: Related to events or people from the past.

sentences.english: places of historical interest
sentences.chinese: 历史名胜

sentences.english: It is important to look at the novel in its historical context .
sentences.chinese: 在历史背景下看待这部小说很重要。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the past

name: hot
trans: Having a high temperature.

sentences.english: a hot day in July
sentences.chinese: 7月炎热的一天

sentences.english: a hot curry
sentences.chinese: 一种辛辣的咖喱

detailed_translations.english: something that is hot has a high temperature - used about weather, places, food, drink, or objects

name: useful
trans: Able to be used in a practical or beneficial way.

sentences.english: useful information
sentences.chinese: 有用的信息

sentences.english: A little Japanese can be really useful.
sentences.chinese: 懂一点日语非常有用。

sentences.english: Can you come and make yourself useful(= help people to do something )?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能过来帮点忙？

detailed_translations.chinese: 有用的，有益的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: helping you to do or get what you want

name: mental
trans: Related to the mind or mental processes.

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

name: scared
trans: Feeling afraid or frightened.

sentences.english: At first, he was really scared.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始时他非常害怕。

detailed_translations.english: frightened of something, or nervous about something

name: additional
trans: Extra or supplementary.

sentences.english: Additional information can be obtained from the centre.
sentences.chinese: 可以从中心获取更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: more than what was agreed or expected

name: emotional
trans: Related to or influenced by feelings.

sentences.english: She provided emotional support at a very distressing time for me.
sentences.chinese: 在我非常痛苦的时候，她是我的情感支柱。

sentences.english: Ann suffered from depression and a number of other emotional problems.
sentences.chinese: 安患了抑郁症，还遇到一些其他的情绪问题。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional state of the patient
sentences.chinese: 患者的生理和情绪状态

sentences.english: The funeral was a very emotional experience for all of us.
sentences.chinese: 那次葬礼对我们大家来说都是一次无比伤感的经历。

sentences.english: He became very emotional when we had to leave.
sentences.chinese: 当我们不得不离开时，他非常伤感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 情绪(上)的，情感(上)的；激起感情的； 敏感的；情绪激动的〔尤指哭泣〕
detailed_translations.english: relating to your feelings or how you control them

name: old
trans: Having existed for a long time or showing signs of age.

sentences.english: an old man
sentences.chinese: 一位老人

sentences.english: How old are you?
sentences.chinese: 你多大年纪？

sentences.english: Are you older than Sally?
sentences.chinese: 你比萨莉大吗？

sentences.english: You’re old enough to get your own breakfast now.
sentences.chinese: 你现在已经长大，可以自己弄早餐了。

sentences.english: I’m not coming skating. I’m too old for that now.
sentences.chinese: 我不去玩溜冰，我现在太老玩不动了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is old has lived for a very long time

name: political
trans: Related to the government or the public affairs of a country.

sentences.english: a monarch without political power
sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .
sentences.chinese: 他曾是个政治犯。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the state, government or public affairs

name: similar
trans: Having some qualities or characteristics in common.

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: healthy
trans: In good physical or mental condition.

sentences.english: a healthy baby boy
sentences.chinese: 健康的男婴

sentences.english: I’ve always been perfectly healthy until now.
sentences.chinese: 直到现在，我的身体一直非常健康。

sentences.english: a healthy lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 健康的生活方式

detailed_translations.english: physically strong and not likely to become ill or weak

name: financial
trans: Related to money or finance.

sentences.english: financial transactions
sentences.chinese: 财务往来

sentences.english: financial assistance
sentences.chinese: 财务援助

sentences.english: a financial advisor
sentences.chinese: 财务顾问

sentences.english: Organic farmers should be encouraged with financial incentives.
sentences.chinese: 应对实行有机栽培的农民给予经济上的鼓励。

sentences.english: It was a wonderful film, but not exactly a financial success (= something that makes a profit ) .
sentences.chinese: 这是一部出色的影片，但在票房上不是很成功。

detailed_translations.english: relating to money or the management of money

name: medical
trans: Related to the treatment or study of medical conditions.

sentences.english: medical research
sentences.chinese: 医学研究

sentences.english: medical staff
sentences.chinese: 医务人员

sentences.english: a medical student
sentences.chinese: 医科学生

sentences.english: a patient’s medical history
sentences.chinese: 患者的病史

sentences.english: medical or surgical treatment
sentences.chinese: 内科或外科疗法

detailed_translations.english: relating to medicine and the treatment of disease or injury

name: traditional
trans: Based on long-established customs or beliefs.

sentences.english: traditional Italian cooking
sentences.chinese: 传统的意大利烹饪

sentences.english: a traditional Irish folk song
sentences.chinese: 传统的爱尔兰民歌

sentences.english: a traditional method of brewing beer
sentences.chinese: 传统的啤酒酿造方法

detailed_translations.english: being part of the traditions of a country or group of people

name: federal
trans: Related to the national government of a country.

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: entire
trans: Complete or whole.

sentences.english: It was the worst day in my entire life.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一生中最糟糕的一天。

sentences.english: The entire staff agreed.
sentences.chinese: 全体员工都同意了。

sentences.english: Have you drunk the entire bottle?
sentences.chinese: 你把整瓶酒都喝了吗？

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount etc

name: strong
trans: Having great power or strength.

sentences.english: He was a big strong man.
sentences.chinese: 他高大健壮。

sentences.english: Jack was tall and strong.
sentences.chinese: 杰克又高又壮。

sentences.english: I’m not strong enough to fight him.
sentences.chinese: 和他打我还不够强壮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚强的；强壮的；牢固的；擅长的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of physical power so that you can lift heavy things, do hard physical work etc

name: actual
trans: Real or existing in fact.

sentences.english: I’m not joking. Those were his actual words.
sentences.chinese: 我没开玩笑，那都是他的原话。

sentences.english: I know Germany won, but I can’t tell you the actual score.
sentences.chinese: 我知道德国队胜了，但我不知道确切的比分。

sentences.english: Interest is only charged on the actual amount borrowed.
sentences.chinese: 利息只按实际借款额收取。

sentences.english: In actual fact (= really  ) , there is little evidence to support the allegations.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这些指控几乎没有证据支持。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is real or exact

name: significant
trans: Important or notable.

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: successful
trans: Achieving the desired outcome or goals.

sentences.english: The operation was successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术成功了。

sentences.english: a highly successful (= very successful ) meeting
sentences.chinese: 十分成功的会议

detailed_translations.english: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended

name: electrical
trans: Related to electricity or electrical devices.

sentences.english: The fire was caused by an electrical fault.
sentences.chinese: 大火是电力故障引起的。

sentences.english: an electrical engineer
sentences.chinese: 电力[电气]工程师

detailed_translations.english: relating to electricity

name: expensive
trans: Costing a lot of money.

sentences.english: the most expensive restaurant in town
sentences.chinese: 城里最贵的餐馆

sentences.english: Petrol is becoming more and more expensive.
sentences.chinese: 汽油越来越贵了。

sentences.english: Photography is an expensive hobby.
sentences.chinese: 摄影是一项很花钱的业余爱好。

sentences.english: For low-income families, children’s safety equipment can be prohibitively expensive (= so expensive that most people cannot afford it ).
sentences.chinese: 对于低收入家庭来说，儿童的安全设备贵得让人望而却步。

sentences.english: Employing the wrong builder can be a horribly expensive mistake.
sentences.chinese: 用错建筑工人有时会是代价高昂的错误。

sentences.english: Her husband had expensive tastes (= liked expensive things ).
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫喜欢的东西都很贵。

detailed_translations.english: costing a lot of money

name: pregnant
trans: Carrying a developing offspring within the body.

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body

name: intelligent
trans: Having a high level of mental ability or sharpness.

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: interesting
trans: Captivating or arousing curiosity.

sentences.english: That’s an interesting question.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个有趣的问题。

sentences.english: a really interesting TV programme
sentences.chinese: 十分有趣的电视节目

sentences.english: Did you meet any interesting people?
sentences.chinese: 你见过什么有意思的人吗？

sentences.english: It’s interesting that no one remembers seeing the car.
sentences.chinese: 竟然没人记得见过这辆车，真是有趣。

detailed_translations.english: attracting your attention because it is special, exciting or unusual

name: poor
trans: Lacking in material possessions or financial wealth.

sentences.english: Her family were so poor they couldn’t afford to buy her new clothes.
sentences.chinese: 她家穷得甚至买不起新衣服给她。

sentences.english: an area where poor people lived
sentences.chinese: 穷人居住区

sentences.english: one of the poorest countries in the world
sentences.chinese: 世界上最贫穷的国家之一

sentences.english: a poor part of Chicago (= where a lot of poor people live )
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥的一个贫民区

sentences.english: My grandparents grew up dirt poor (= very poor ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的祖父母在赤贫的环境里长大。

sentences.english: The country is poor in natural resources.
sentences.chinese: 该国自然资源匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: having very little money and not many possessions

name: happy
trans: Feeling or expressing joy or contentment.

sentences.english: It’s a lovely house and we’ve been very happy here.
sentences.chinese: 房子很漂亮，我们住在这里非常开心。

sentences.english: I’ve never felt happier in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我一生从未感到如此快乐。

sentences.english: He was a happy child who rarely cried.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个快乐的孩子，很少哭鼻子。

sentences.english: the happy faces of the children
sentences.chinese: 孩子们快乐的表情

sentences.english: This has been the happiest day of my life.
sentences.chinese: 这是我一生中最快乐的一天。

detailed_translations.english: having feelings of pleasure, for example because something good has happened to you or you are very satisfied with your life

name: responsible
trans: Being accountable or answerable for something.

sentences.english: We are determined to bring the people responsible to justice.
sentences.chinese: 我们决意要将肇事者绳之以法。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is responsible for an accident, mistake, crime etc, it is their fault or they can be blamed

name: cute
trans: Attractive or endearing.

sentences.english: a cute little puppy
sentences.chinese: 一只逗人爱的小狗

sentences.english: The baby’s so cute.
sentences.chinese: 这婴儿真可爱。

sentences.english: That’s a really cute outfit.
sentences.chinese: 那套衣服真漂亮。

detailed_translations.english: very pretty or attractive

name: helpful
trans: Providing assistance or support.

sentences.english: Thank you for your advice; it’s been very helpful.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你的建议，它非常有用。

sentences.english: It is helpful if we address a few key questions here.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们在这里解决一些关键问题会很有用的。

detailed_translations.english: providing useful help in making a situation better or easier

name: recent
trans: Happening or occurring in the near past.

sentences.english: Irving’s most recent book
sentences.chinese: 欧文最新的书

sentences.english: recent research into the causes of cancer
sentences.chinese: 近来对致癌原因的研究

sentences.english: the recent past
sentences.chinese: 不久前

detailed_translations.english: having happened or started only a short time ago

name: willing
trans: Ready or inclined to do something.

sentences.english: How much are they willing to pay?
sentences.chinese: 他们愿意付多少钱？

detailed_translations.english: prepared to do something, or having no reason to not want to do it

name: nice
trans: Pleasant or agreeable.

sentences.english: They’ve got a very nice house.
sentences.chinese: 他们的房子真漂亮。

sentences.english: Did you have a nice time?
sentences.chinese: 你们玩得开心吗？

sentences.english: It’s such a nice day (= good weather ), why not go for a swim?
sentences.chinese: 天气真好，为什么不去游泳呢？

sentences.english: What a nice surprise!
sentences.chinese: 真是个惊喜！

sentences.english: One of the nice things about Christmas is having all the family together.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节的一个好处是全家可以聚首一堂。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant, attractive, or enjoyable

name: wonderful
trans: Remarkable or delightful.

sentences.english: It’s wonderful what doctors can do nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 如今医生的本领着实令人称奇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极好的，精彩的，绝妙的；奇妙的；美妙；胜；神妙
detailed_translations.english: making you admire someone or something very much

name: impossible
trans: Not capable of happening or being achieved.

sentences.english: ‘I want to speak to Mr Franks.’ ‘I’m afraid that’s impossible.’
sentences.chinese: “我想和弗兰克斯先生谈谈。”“恐怕不行。”

sentences.english: It’s impossible to be accurate about these things.
sentences.chinese: 这些事情不可能准确无误 。

sentences.english: The noise made sleep impossible.
sentences.chinese: 噪音吵得人无法睡觉。

sentences.english: Members with young children often found it impossible to attend evening meetings.
sentences.chinese: 有小孩的会员常觉得没法参加晚上的聚会。

sentences.english: It is difficult to find work these days, but for blind people it is virtually impossible.
sentences.chinese: 现在找工作很难，对于盲人来说几乎是不可能。

sentences.english: He was faced with a seemingly impossible task.
sentences.chinese: 他面临着似乎不可能完成的任务。

sentences.english: It was physically impossible to get the fridge through the door.
sentences.chinese: 根本不可能把冰箱从这扇门搬过去。

sentences.english: Six months ago, peace seemed an impossible dream.
sentences.chinese: 六个月前和平还似乎是个无法实现的梦。

sentences.english: Such mental attitudes are difficult, if not impossible, to change.
sentences.chinese: 即使有可能，要改变这样的心态也是很难的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impossible cannot happen or be done

name: serious
trans: Grave or important in nature or consequences.

sentences.english: the serious problem of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 严重的失业问题

sentences.english: Luckily, the damage was not serious.
sentences.chinese: 还好，损坏不算严重。

sentences.english: Serious crimes have increased dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 重大犯罪案件大幅度增加了。

sentences.english: Oil spills pose a serious threat to marine life.
sentences.chinese: 原油泄漏对海洋生物构成了严重威胁。

sentences.english: The president was in serious trouble .
sentences.chinese: 总统遇到大麻烦了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，严重的；认真的；庄重的；危急的
detailed_translations.english: a serious situation, problem, accident etc is extremely bad or dangerous

name: huge
trans: Extremely large in size or amount.

sentences.english: a huge dog
sentences.chinese: 一条大狗

sentences.english: huge crowds
sentences.chinese: 大群大群的人

sentences.english: Your room’s huge compared to mine.
sentences.chinese: 你的房间跟我的比很大。

sentences.english: These shoes make my feet look huge.
sentences.chinese: 这双鞋让我的脚看上去大极了。

sentences.english: the huge scale of the problem
sentences.chinese: 该问题的严重性

detailed_translations.english: extremely large in size, amount, or degree

name: rare
trans: Not occurring or found very often; uncommon.

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

name: technical
trans: Relating to a particular subject, skill, or craft, requiring specialized knowledge.

sentences.english: Our staff will be available to give you technical support .
sentences.chinese: 有我们的员工向你提供技术支持。

sentences.english: I have no technical knowledge at all.
sentences.chinese: 我一点技术知识都没有。

sentences.english: technical training
sentences.chinese: 技术培训

detailed_translations.english: connected with knowledge of how machines work

name: typical
trans: Exhibiting the characteristics or qualities of a particular type or group.

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

name: competitive
trans: Involving or characterized by rivalry or competition.

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

name: critical
trans: Expressing disapproval or negative comments; crucial, decisive.

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

name: electronic
trans: Relating to or using devices that operate on the principles governing the behavior of electrons, especially the flow of electrons through semiconductors.

sentences.english: electronic games
sentences.chinese: 电子游戏

sentences.english: an electronic organizer (= a small piece of electronic equipment that you can use to record addresses, phone numbers etc )
sentences.chinese: 电子记事本

detailed_translations.english: electronic equipment, such as computers and televisions, uses electricity that has passed through computer chips, transistors etc

name: immediate
trans: Happening or done without delay; instant.

sentences.english: Our immediate response to the attack was sheer horror.
sentences.chinese: 我们对攻击的第一反应就是非常惊恐。

sentences.english: They promise immediate action to help the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 他们承诺立即采取行动帮助失业者。

sentences.english: If the eyes are affected, seek immediate medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼睛感染了要立即就医。

sentences.english: The funeral was attended by her immediate family (= her parents, children, brothers and sisters) only.
sentences.chinese: 只有她的直系亲属参加了葬礼。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done at once and without delay

name: aware
trans: Having knowledge or perception of a situation or fact.

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: educational
trans: Providing education; instructive or informative.

sentences.english: the educational development of children
sentences.chinese: 儿童的教育发展

detailed_translations.english: relating to education

name: environmental
trans: Relating to the natural world and the impact of human activity on its condition.

sentences.english: the environmental damage caused by the chemical industry
sentences.chinese: 化学工业对环境造成的破坏

sentences.english: an international meeting to discuss environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 探讨环境问题的国际会议

sentences.english: the environmental impact of pollution from cars
sentences.chinese: 汽车造成的污染对环境的影响

sentences.english: an environmental group
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织

detailed_translations.english: concerning or affecting the air, land, or water on Earth

name: global
trans: Relating to the whole world; worldwide.

sentences.english: global climate change
sentences.chinese: 全球气候变化

sentences.english: the global economy
sentences.chinese: 全球经济

detailed_translations.english: affecting or including the whole world

name: legal
trans: Permitted by law; relating to the law.

sentences.english: What the company has done is perfectly legal.
sentences.chinese: 公司所做的这一切完全合法。

sentences.english: plans to make the carrying of identity cards a legal requirement
sentences.chinese: 使携带身份证成为法定要求的计划

sentences.english: He had twice the legal limit of alcohol in his bloodstream.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量是法定限度的两倍。

sentences.english: a pressure group that is campaigning to make cannabis legal
sentences.chinese: 争取大麻合法化的压力团体

detailed_translations.english: if something is legal, you are allowed to do it or have to do it by law

name: relevant
trans: Closely connected or appropriate to what is being done or considered.

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

name: accurate
trans: Correct in all details; exact.

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: capable
trans: Having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do or achieve a specified thing.

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

name: dangerous
trans: Able or likely to cause harm or injury.

sentences.english: laws about dangerous dogs
sentences.chinese: 有关危险犬类的法律

sentences.english: Some of these prisoners are extremely dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 这些囚犯中有些极为危险。

sentences.english: The powdered milk was not as good as breast milk, and was downright dangerous (= actually dangerous ) when it was mixed with unclean water.
sentences.chinese: 奶粉没有母乳好，用不洁净的水冲调更会造成危险。

detailed_translations.english: able or likely to harm or kill you

name: dramatic
trans: Full of action, emotion, or exciting qualities; striking.

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: efficient
trans: Achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort or expense.

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

name: powerful
trans: Having great power or strength; influential.

sentences.english: He was one of the most powerful men in Bohemia.
sentences.chinese: 他是波希米亚最有权势的人物之一。

sentences.english: a very influential and powerful family
sentences.chinese: 很有权势的家庭

sentences.english: a powerful speech
sentences.chinese: 有感染力的演讲

detailed_translations.english: a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions

name: foreign
trans: Belonging to or coming from a country or place other than the one you are in.

sentences.english: foreign students
sentences.chinese: 外国学生

sentences.english: Can you speak any foreign languages?
sentences.chinese: 你会讲外语吗？

detailed_translations.english: from or relating to a country that is not your own

name: hungry
trans: Feeling or displaying the need for food.

sentences.english: I was cold, tired, and hungry.
sentences.chinese: 我又冷，又累，又饿。

sentences.english: If you get hungry, there’s some cold chicken in the fridge.
sentences.chinese: 你要是饿了，冰箱里有些冷鸡肉。

sentences.english: Do you still feel hungry?
sentences.chinese: 你还觉得饿吗？

sentences.english: She is hungry for success.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望成功。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to eat something

name: practical
trans: Of or concerned with the actual doing or use of something rather than with theory and ideas.

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: psychological
trans: Relating to the mental and emotional state of a person.

sentences.english: Sleep disorders are a serious psychological problem .
sentences.chinese: 睡眠障碍是严重的心理疾病。

sentences.english: Freud’s psychological theories
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德的心理学理论

sentences.english: What was the patient’s psychological state ?
sentences.chinese: 病人的心理状态如何？

detailed_translations.english: relating to the way that your mind works and the way that this affects your behaviour

name: severe
trans: Very great or intense; harsh.

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: suitable
trans: Right or appropriate for a particular person, purpose, or situation.

sentences.english: We are hoping to find a suitable school.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望能找到一所合适的学校。

detailed_translations.english: having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation

name: numerous
trans: Great in number; many.

sentences.english: Numerous attempts have been made to hide the truth.
sentences.chinese: 为掩盖事实作了很多尝试。

sentences.english: The two leaders have worked together on numerous occasions.
sentences.chinese: 那两位领导人已经多次合作。

detailed_translations.english: many

name: sufficient
trans: Enough; adequate.

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

name: unusual
trans: Not commonly seen or done; rare.

sentences.english: an unusual feature
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的特点

sentences.english: unusual circumstances
sentences.chinese: 异常状况

sentences.english: It’s unusual for Dave to be late.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫迟到是很少见的。

sentences.english: (= it is quite common ) to feel very angry in a situation like this.
sentences.chinese: 遇到这样的情况觉得非常生气是很正常的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不平常的， 少有的； 独特的， 与众不同的
detailed_translations.english: different from what is usual or normal

name: consistent
trans: Acting or done in the same way over time, especially so as to be fair or accurate.

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

name: cultural
trans: Relating to the ideas, customs, and social behavior of a society.

sentences.english: the very real historical and cultural differences between our two societies
sentences.chinese: 我们两个社会之间非常现实的历史和文化差异

sentences.english: the desire to maintain a distinct cultural identity
sentences.chinese: 保持独特的文化特征的愿望

sentences.english: It is important to look at the political and cultural context in which the novel was written.
sentences.chinese: 要考虑小说创作时的政治和文化背景，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: people who share the same cultural background
sentences.chinese: 有着相同文化背景的人

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to a particular society and its way of life

name: existing
trans: Continuing to be present or in use; not destroyed or lost.

name: famous
trans: Known about by many people.

sentences.english: a famous actor
sentences.chinese: 著名演员

sentences.english: Many famous people have stayed in the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 许多名人都曾下榻这家酒店。

sentences.english: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark (= a famous place or building that is easy to recognize ) .
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔是著名的地标。

sentences.english: Da Vinci’s world-famous portrait of the Mona Lisa
sentences.chinese: 达•芬奇的那幅闻名世界的肖像画《蒙娜丽莎》

detailed_translations.english: known about by many people in many places

name: pure
trans: Not mixed or adulterated with any other substance or material.

sentences.english: rings made of pure gold
sentences.chinese: 纯金制成的戒指

sentences.english: Our beef patties are 100% pure.
sentences.chinese: 我们的牛肉饼是100%的纯牛肉。

sentences.english: His motives were pure.
sentences.chinese: 他动机纯正。

detailed_translations.english: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added

name: afraid
trans: Feeling fear or anxiety; frightened.

sentences.english: There’s no need to be afraid.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要害怕。

sentences.english: He was afraid that the other kids would laugh at him.
sentences.chinese: 他担心其他孩子会嘲笑他。

detailed_translations.english: frightened because you think that you may get hurt or that something bad may happen

name: obvious
trans: Easily perceived or understood; clear.

sentences.english: The obvious way of reducing pollution is to use cars less.
sentences.chinese: 减少污染显而易见的办法就是少用汽车。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice or understand

name: careful
trans: Making sure of avoiding potential danger, mishap, or harm; cautious.

sentences.english: Any school trip requires careful planning.
sentences.chinese: 学校的任何出游活动都需要周密的安排。

detailed_translations.english: giving a lot of attention to details

name: latter
trans: Denoting the second or second mentioned of two people or things.

sentences.english: In the latter case, buyers pay a 15% commission.
sentences.chinese: 在后一种情况下，买家付15%的佣金。

detailed_translations.english: being the second of two people or things, or the last in a list just mentioned

name: unhappy
trans: Not happy; sad or depressed.

sentences.english: If you’re so unhappy, why don’t you change jobs?
sentences.chinese: 你要是那么不开心，为什么不换个工作呢？

sentences.english: Leslie had an unhappy childhood.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯利的童年很不幸。

sentences.english: an unhappy marriage
sentences.chinese: 不幸的婚姻

sentences.english: I was desperately unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 我非常不快乐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不快乐的；不幸福的；不适当的
detailed_translations.english: not happy

name: acceptable
trans: Able to be agreed on; suitable.

sentences.english: Students who achieve an acceptable standard will progress to degree studies.
sentences.chinese: 达到一定程度的学生可以进一步攻读学位。

sentences.english: How do we reach an acceptable level of data security?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何使数据安全达到令人满意的程度？

detailed_translations.english: good enough to be used for a particular purpose or to be considered satisfactory

name: aggressive
trans: Ready or likely to attack or confront; characterized by or resulting from aggression.

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: boring
trans: Not interesting; dull.

sentences.english: Her husband is about the most boring person I’ve ever met.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫可以说是我见过的最无聊的人。

sentences.english: The job was dull and boring.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作枯燥乏味。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人厌烦的， 乏味的， 无聊的
detailed_translations.english: not interesting in any way

name: distinct
trans: Recognizably different in nature from something else of a similar type.

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

name: eastern
trans: Relating to or characteristic of the east.

sentences.english: the eastern shore of the island
sentences.chinese: 岛的东岸

sentences.english: farmers in eastern England
sentences.chinese: 英格兰东部的农民

sentences.english: Eastern religions
sentences.chinese: 东方宗教

detailed_translations.english: in or from the east of a country or area

name: logical
trans: Characterized by clear reasoning; sensible.

sentences.english: It’s a logical site for a new supermarket, with the housing development nearby.
sentences.chinese: 附近有住宅区，新的超级市场选址在此是合情合理的。

sentences.english: a logical conclusion
sentences.chinese: 合理的结论

detailed_translations.chinese: 逻辑的， 合乎常理的
detailed_translations.english: seeming reasonable and sensible

name: reasonable
trans: Having sound judgment; fair and sensible.

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

name: strict
trans: Demanding that rules concerning behavior are obeyed and observed.

sentences.english: a strict teacher
sentences.chinese: 严格的老师

detailed_translations.english: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say

name: administrative
trans: Relating to the running of a business, organization, or institution.

sentences.english: The job is mainly administrative.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是行政方面的。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the work of managing a company or organization

name: automatic
trans: Working by itself with little or no direct human control.

sentences.english: an automatic weapon
sentences.chinese: 自动武器

sentences.english: an automatic gearbox
sentences.chinese: 自动变速箱

sentences.english: My camera is fully automatic .
sentences.chinese: 我的照相机是全自动的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自动的； 必然发生的； 无意识的
detailed_translations.english: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process
a weapon that can fire bullets continuously

name: civil
trans: Relating to ordinary citizens and their concerns, as distinct from military or ecclesiastical matters.

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

name: former
trans: Referring to something that existed or was present in the past.

sentences.english: the former Soviet Union
sentences.chinese: 前苏联

sentences.english: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
sentences.chinese: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

sentences.english: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种可能性中，前者似乎更有可能。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing before, but not now
the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

name: massive
trans: Very large or heavy.

sentences.english: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.english: the castle’s massive walls
sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

name: southern
trans: Relating to or located in the south.

sentences.english: a southern accent
sentences.chinese: 南部口音

sentences.english: Southern Italy
sentences.chinese: 意大利南部

detailed_translations.english: in or from the south of a country or area

name: unfair
trans: Treating someone in a way that is not just or impartial.

sentences.english: an unfair advantage
sentences.chinese: 不公平的优势

sentences.english: laws aimed at preventing unfair competition
sentences.chinese: 旨在防止不公平竞争的法令

sentences.english: Many employers have recognized that age discrimination is unfair.
sentences.chinese: 许多雇主已经认识到年龄歧视是不公平的。

sentences.english: She won £20,000 for unfair dismissal(= being illegally made to leave your job ).
sentences.chinese: 她因被不公平解雇而得到两万英镑的赔偿。

detailed_translations.english: not right or fair, especially because not everyone has an equal opportunity

name: visible
trans: Able to be seen or perceived.

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: alive
trans: Having life or existing in a state of living.

sentences.english: It was a bad accident – they’re lucky to be alive.
sentences.chinese: 这是一宗严重事故——他们能活着实属幸运。

sentences.english: My grandparents are still alive .
sentences.chinese: 我的祖父母和外祖父母都还健在。

sentences.english: We stayed alive by eating berries.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃浆果活命。

sentences.english: He was kept alive on a life-support machine.
sentences.chinese: 他靠生命维持装置活着。

sentences.english: Apparently he’s alive and well and living in Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 看来他还健在，住在巴西。

detailed_translations.chinese: 活着的；活泼的；有生气的
detailed_translations.english: still living and not dead

name: angry
trans: Feeling or expressing strong displeasure or hostility.

sentences.english: I was angry because he hadn’t told me his plans.
sentences.chinese: 我很生气，因为他没有告诉我他的计划。

sentences.english: He was beginning to get angry .
sentences.chinese: 他开始发脾气了。

sentences.english: His comments brought an angry response from opposition politicians.
sentences.chinese: 他的话激起反对派政客愤怒的回应。

sentences.english: ‘Calm down,’ she said, looking at his angry face.
sentences.chinese: “冷静一下。”她看着他那张生气的脸说道。

sentences.english: Jesse laughed, which made me even angrier .
sentences.chinese: 杰西笑了起来，这令我更加恼火。

detailed_translations.english: feeling strong emotions which make you want to shout at someone or hurt them because they have behaved in an unfair, cruel, offensive etc way, or because you think that a situation is unfair, unacceptable etc

name: desperate
trans: Feeling or showing a sense of urgency or hopelessness.

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

name: exciting
trans: Causing great enthusiasm or eagerness.

sentences.english: an exciting discovery
sentences.chinese: 激动人心的发现

sentences.english: ‘Julia and Paul are getting married!’ ‘Oh, how exciting!’
sentences.chinese: “朱莉娅和保罗要结婚了！”“啊，太让人兴奋了！”

sentences.english: I’ve got some very exciting news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我给你带来了一些很激动人心的消息。

sentences.english: Let’s do something exciting.
sentences.chinese: 我们来做些让人振奋的事情吧。

sentences.english: Melanie finds her work exciting and rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 梅拉妮觉得自己的工作既刺激又有意义。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel excited

name: friendly
trans: Kind and pleasant to others.

sentences.english: a friendly smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

sentences.english: I’ve found a great pub – good beer and a friendly atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 我找到了一家很棒的酒馆——啤酒好，氛围也亲切。

sentences.english: a friendly match against AC Milan
sentences.chinese: 与AC米兰队的友谊赛

detailed_translations.english: behaving towards someone in a way that shows you like them and are ready to talk to them or help them

name: lucky
trans: Fortunate or favored by chance.

sentences.english: I didn’t really know your name – it was just a lucky guess.
sentences.chinese: 我并不知道你的名字―只是运气好猜中的。

sentences.english: a lucky charm
sentences.chinese: 吉祥符

detailed_translations.english: having good luck

name: realistic
trans: Having a practical or sensible understanding of things.

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

name: sorry
trans: Feeling or expressing regret or remorse.

sentences.english: She was very sorry about all the trouble she'd caused.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己造成的麻烦感到很内疚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗憾的；对不起的，抱歉的
detailed_translations.english: feeling ashamed or unhappy about something bad you have done

detailed_translations.chinese: 对不起，抱歉（表示委婉的拒绝等）

name: ugly
trans: Unpleasant or unattractive in appearance.

sentences.english: a very ugly man
sentences.chinese: 非常丑陋的男子

sentences.english: the ugliest building in town
sentences.chinese: 城里最难看的建筑

sentences.english: Nick’s dog is as ugly as sin (= very ugly ).
sentences.chinese: 尼克的狗难看得要命。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丑陋的；邪恶的；令人厌恶的
detailed_translations.english: extremely unattractive and unpleasant to look at

name: unlikely
trans: Not likely to happen or be true.

sentences.english: Donna might be able to come tomorrow, but it’s very unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 唐娜明天也许能来，不过这可能性很小。

detailed_translations.english: not likely to happen

name: anxious
trans: Feeling worried or uneasy about something.

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: comprehensive
trans: Including all or nearly all aspects or elements of something.

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: curious
trans: Eager to know or learn about something.

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

name: impressive
trans: Having the ability to impress or make a strong impact.

sentences.english: The figures certainly look impressive.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字看上去确实很可观。

sentences.english: Among the guests was an impressive array of authors and critics.
sentences.chinese: 来宾中有不少出色的作家和评论家。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc

name: informal
trans: Relaxed, casual, or not formal.

sentences.english: The atmosphere at work is fairly informal.
sentences.chinese: 工作气氛相当轻松。

sentences.english: The two groups met for informal talks.
sentences.chinese: 两个团体会面举行非正式会谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非正式的；不拘礼节的；随便的；通俗的；日常使用的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and friendly without being restricted by rules of correct behaviour

name: inner
trans: Located or existing on the inside.

sentences.english: an inner room
sentences.chinese: 内室

sentences.english: inner London
sentences.chinese: 伦敦中心区

sentences.english: the inner ear
sentences.chinese: 内耳

sentences.english: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽使我感到内心平和。

detailed_translations.english: on the inside or close to the centre of something

name: pleasant
trans: Giving a sense of enjoyment or satisfaction.

sentences.english: It had been a pleasant evening.
sentences.chinese: 那是个愉快的夜晚。

sentences.english: the pleasant climate of Southern California
sentences.chinese: 南加利福尼亚的宜人气候

sentences.english: The restaurant was large and pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅宽敞舒适。

sentences.english: Kate! What a pleasant surprise !
sentences.chinese: 凯特！真是让人惊喜！

detailed_translations.english: enjoyable or attractive and making you feel happy

name: sexual
trans: Relating to or involving sex or sexuality.

sentences.english: a disease passed on by sexual contact
sentences.chinese: 由性接触传染的疾病

sentences.english: allegations of sexual abuse
sentences.chinese: 性虐待的指控

sentences.english: her first sexual experience
sentences.chinese: 她的第一次性经验

sentences.english: Many elderly people continue to have satisfying sexual relationships.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人仍然有满意的性关系。

sentences.english: sexual stereotypes
sentences.chinese: 两性关系的模式化观念

detailed_translations.english: relating to the physical activity of sex

name: sudden
trans: Happening quickly and unexpectedly.

sentences.english: a sudden change in the weather
sentences.chinese: 天气的突然变化

sentences.english: Life is cruel, she thought, with a sudden rush of anger.
sentences.chinese: 生活真残酷，她想，心头突然涌上一股怒气。

sentences.english: a sudden movement
sentences.chinese: 突然的一动

sentences.english: Her death was sudden.
sentences.chinese: 她的死很突然。

detailed_translations.english: happening, coming, or done quickly or when you do not expect it

name: terrible
trans: Extremely bad or unpleasant.

sentences.english: The hotel was absolutely terrible.
sentences.chinese: 这家宾馆糟糕透了。

sentences.english: I’d better write this down; I have a terrible memory.
sentences.chinese: 我最好把它记下来，我的记性很差。

sentences.english: You’re making a terrible mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个极大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: very bad

name: unable
trans: Not able to do something.

sentences.english: The military may feel unable to hand over power to a civilian president next year.
sentences.chinese: 军方可能觉得无法在明年把政权移交给一位民选总统。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不会的，不能的；[劳经] 无能力的；不能胜任的
detailed_translations.english: not able to do something

name: weak
trans: Lacking strength or power.

sentences.english: The illness left her feeling weak.
sentences.chinese: 疾病使她感到身体虚弱。

sentences.english: Poor light produces weak plants.
sentences.chinese: 光照不足，植物就生长不好。

sentences.english: The animal was weak from loss of blood.
sentences.chinese: 那只动物因失血而虚弱无力。

detailed_translations.chinese: [经] 疲软的；虚弱的；无力的；不牢固的
detailed_translations.english: not physically strong

name: wooden
trans: Made of or resembling wood.

sentences.english: a wooden bench
sentences.chinese: 木制长椅

detailed_translations.english: made of wood

name: asleep
trans: In a state of sleep.

sentences.english: Quiet! The baby’s asleep.
sentences.chinese: 安静！ 宝宝在睡觉。

detailed_translations.english: sleeping

name: confident
trans: Feeling or showing certainty or assurance.

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: conscious
trans: Aware of one's surroundings, thoughts, and feelings.

sentences.english: I became conscious of someone watching me.
sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty
sentences.chinese: 有意而为的残暴行径

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

name: decent
trans: Conforming with generally accepted standards of propriety or morality.

sentences.english: a decent burial
sentences.chinese: 得体的葬礼

sentences.english: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 保罗过于频繁地光顾当地酒吧，不太合乎高级讲师的身份。

sentences.english: The chairman did the decent thing (= did what people thought he ought to ) and resigned.
sentences.chinese: 主席体面地辞去了职务。

detailed_translations.english: following moral standards that are acceptable to society

name: embarrassed
trans: Feeling or showing embarrassment or shame.

sentences.english: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌，她就会难为情。

sentences.english: He looked embarrassed when I asked him where he’d been.
sentences.chinese: 我问他去了哪里，他显得很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public

name: guilty
trans: Having committed an offense or wrongdoing.

sentences.english: She looked self-conscious and guilty.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去很不自然，很内疚的样子。

sentences.english: He was found not guilty of the death of PC Jones.
sentences.chinese: 关于警员琼斯的死，他被判无罪。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very ashamed and sad because you know that you have done something wrong

name: lonely
trans: Feeling sad or unhappy because one is alone or isolated.

sentences.english: a lonely old man
sentences.chinese: 一个孤单的老人

sentences.english: Don’t you get lonely being on your own all day?
sentences.chinese: 你整天独自一人不感到寂寞吗？

detailed_translations.english: unhappy because you are alone or do not have anyone to talk to

name: mad
trans: Feeling or showing anger or insanity.

sentences.english: He can’t possibly get that finished in time. He must be mad !
sentences.chinese: 他不可能按时完成的。他一定是疯了！

sentences.english: I’d go mad (= start to feel crazy ) if I was stuck at home all day.
sentences.chinese: 如果我整天困在家里我会发疯的。

sentences.english: He’s been driving me mad !
sentences.chinese: 他真让我受不了！

sentences.english: You’ve agreed to marry him! Are you mad?
sentences.chinese: 你已经同意跟他结婚了！你疯了吗？

sentences.english: Surely no one would be mad enough to fly in this weather?
sentences.chinese: 肯定没有人会傻到在这样的天气条件下飞行吧？

sentences.english: My friends all think I’m stark raving mad (= completely crazy ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友都认为我是彻底疯了。

sentences.english: It’s enough to send you barking mad (= completely crazy ) .
sentences.chinese: 这足以让你发狂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疯狂的；发疯的；愚蠢的；着迷的
detailed_translations.english: crazy or very silly

name: nervous
trans: Feeling or showing anxiety or apprehension.

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

name: odd
trans: Different from what is usual or expected.

sentences.english: It was an odd thing to say.
sentences.chinese: 这话说得很奇怪。

sentences.english: an odd way to behave
sentences.chinese: 古怪的行为

sentences.english: They’re an odd couple.
sentences.chinese: 他们是古怪的一对。

sentences.english: There was something odd about him.
sentences.chinese: 他这人有些奇怪。

sentences.english: What she did was unforgivable, but the odd thing was he didn’t seem to mind.
sentences.chinese: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的，但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。

sentences.english: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她手持一件非常奇特的武器。

detailed_translations.english: different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand

name: remarkable
trans: Worthy of attention or notice because of being unusual or extraordinary.

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: substantial
trans: Considerable in amount or value.

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.english: The document requires substantial changes.
sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可观的， 大量的； 物质的， 坚固的； 实质的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

name: suspicious
trans: Having or showing a cautious distrust of someone or something.

sentences.english: His reluctance to answer my questions made me suspicious .
sentences.chinese: 他不愿回答我的问题，这引起我的怀疑。

sentences.english: She gave him a suspicious glance.
sentences.chinese: 她向他投去怀疑的一瞥。

sentences.english: You’ve got a very suspicious mind!
sentences.chinese: 你真是疑心太重！

detailed_translations.english: thinking that someone might be guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: tall
trans: Having a greater than average height.

sentences.english: He was young and tall.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，身材高大。

sentences.english: a house surrounded by tall trees
sentences.chinese: 大树环绕的房子

sentences.english: This bush grows tall very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 这种灌木很快就能长高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 高的；长的；过分的；夸大的
detailed_translations.english: a person, building, tree etc that is tall is a greater height than normal

detailed_translations.chinese: (Tall)人名；(马里、阿拉伯)塔勒；(芬、罗、瑞典)塔尔；(英)托尔；(土)塔勒

name: tiny
trans: Very small in size.

sentences.english: a tiny community in the Midwest
sentences.chinese: 中西部地区一个极小的社区

sentences.english: The earrings were tiny.
sentences.chinese: 耳环很小。

sentences.english: a tiny little baby
sentences.chinese: 丁点大的婴儿

sentences.english: She always felt a tiny bit sad.
sentences.chinese: 她总是感到一丝悲伤。

sentences.english: Bad teachers are a tiny minority .
sentences.chinese: 差老师只占极少数。

sentences.english: tiny pieces of paper
sentences.chinese: 碎纸屑片

detailed_translations.english: extremely small

name: more
trans: A comparative form indicating a greater quantity or degree.

sentences.english: I have no more questions.
sentences.chinese: 我没问题了。

sentences.english: The film deserves more attention from the public.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片应受到公众的更多注意。

sentences.english: The accident taught him to be more careful.
sentences.chinese: 这起事故的教训使他变得更小心。

detailed_translations.english: a greater amount or number
having a particular quality to a greater degree

name: some
trans: An unspecified amount or number.

sentences.english: I’ve just made a pot of coffee. Would you like some?
sentences.chinese: 我刚煮了一壶咖啡，你想喝点吗？

sentences.english: ‘Do you know where the screws are?’ ‘There are some in the garage.’
sentences.chinese: “你知道螺丝钉在哪儿吗？”“车库里有一些。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 一些；某个；大约；相当多的
一些；若干；其中的一部分；（数量不确切时用）有些人
detailed_translations.english: a number of people or things or an amount of something, when the exact number or amount is not stated
a fairly large number or amount of something

name: one
trans: Referring to a single person or thing.

sentences.english: They had one daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他们有一个女儿。

sentences.english: one hundred and twenty-one pounds
sentences.chinese: 121英镑

sentences.english: Come back at one (= one o’clock ).
sentences.chinese: 1点钟回来。

sentences.english: Katie’s almost one (= one year old ).
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂快满一岁了。

sentences.english: The children seemed upset. One was crying.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子好像不开心，有一个在哭。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1
used to refer to a member of a group or pair of people or things

name: all
trans: The whole quantity or extent of something.

sentences.english: There is built-in storage space in all bedrooms.
sentences.chinese: 所有卧室里都有内置储藏空间。

sentences.english: the restaurant that Hugh and all his friends go to
sentences.chinese: 休和他所有的朋友们去的那家饭馆

detailed_translations.english: the whole of an amount, thing, or type of thing
the whole of a particular group or thing or to everyone or everything of a particular kind

name: many
trans: A large number of things or people.

sentences.english: Among his many hobbies was the breeding of fine horses.
sentences.chinese: 在他的众多爱好中有饲养名马。

sentences.english: The printing press gave power to a few to change the world for the many.
sentences.chinese: 印刷机赋予了少数人为多数人改变世界的力量。

sentences.english: Not many expected Ferdinand to be such a success this season.
sentences.chinese: 预料到费迪南德在本赛季如此成功的人并不多。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of people or things
many people

name: most
trans: The majority or greatest part of something.

sentences.english: Which class has the most children in it?
sentences.chinese: 哪个班级孩子最多？

sentences.english: She’s one of the most experienced teachers in the district.
sentences.chinese: 她是该地区最有经验的教师之一。

detailed_translations.english: a larger amount or number than anyone or anything else
having the greatest amount of a particular quality

name: other
trans: Referring to something or someone different from what has been mentioned.

sentences.english: The other hotels are all full.
sentences.chinese: 其他的宾馆均已客满。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to all the people or things in a group apart from the one you have already men­tioned or the one that is already known about

name: such
trans: used to indicate a particular type of thing or person.

sentences.english: How dared they do such a thing?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么敢做出这样的事?

sentences.english: He would not succumb to such an item.
sentences.chinese: 他不会对这样的条款做出让步的。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you think that something is not good enough or that there is not enough of it

name: even
trans: used to emphasize something that is surprising or extreme.

sentences.english: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
sentences.chinese: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑，甚至连很大的公司也不例外。

sentences.english: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
sentences.chinese: 这很难看得见，即使开着灯也没有用。

sentences.english: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
sentences.chinese: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.english: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.english: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.chinese: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

name: new
trans: not existing before; recently made or developed.

sentences.english: the city’s new hospital
sentences.chinese: 市里新建的医院

sentences.english: the new issue of ‘Time’ magazine
sentences.chinese: 新一期《时代周刊》

sentences.english: new products on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上的新产品

sentences.english: The hardest part of this job is understanding the new technology.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作最难的地方是理解新技术。

sentences.english: a young man with new ideas
sentences.chinese: 一个有新观念的年轻人

detailed_translations.english: recently made, built, invented, written, designed etc

name: just
trans: based on or behaving according to what is morally right and fair.

sentences.english: A good strong cup of coffee is just what I need right now.
sentences.chinese: 我现在正需要喝一杯浓浓的咖啡。

sentences.english: The house was large and roomy; just right for us.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子大而宽敞，正合我们的需要。

sentences.english: She looks just like her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去就像她妈妈。

sentences.english: It’s nothing serious – just a small cut.
sentences.chinese: 不要紧，只不过是个小伤口。

sentences.english: John’s just told me that he’s getting married.
sentences.chinese: 约翰刚刚告诉我他要结婚了。

detailed_translations.english: exactly

name: good
trans: having desirable or positive qualities; satisfactory in quality, quantity, or degree.

sentences.english: a good hotel
sentences.chinese: 一家不错的宾馆

sentences.english: good quality cloth
sentences.chinese: 优质布料

sentences.english: The train service is not very good.
sentences.chinese: 火车服务不是很好。

sentences.english: My French is better than my Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 我的法语比西班牙语好。

sentences.english: Alex is very good at languages.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯在语言方面很擅长。

sentences.english: She’s a very good player.
sentences.chinese: 她是一名非常优秀的球员。

detailed_translations.english: of a high standard or quality

name: any
trans: used to refer to one or some of a thing or number of things, no matter how much or how many.

sentences.english: Have you got any money?
sentences.chinese: 你身上有没有钱？

sentences.english: Any child who breaks the rules will be punished.
sentences.chinese: 凡违反规定的孩子都要受罚。

detailed_translations.english: some or even the smallest amount or number

name: each
trans: used to refer to every one of two or more people or things, regarded and identified separately.

sentences.english: They reviewed each aspect of the plan bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 他们对计划的各个方面逐一地进行了审核。

name: much
trans: a large amount or to a great degree.

sentences.english: The day ended much as it began.
sentences.chinese: 这一天结束时还像开始时一样。

sentences.english: I don’t have much money with me.
sentences.chinese: 我身上没带很多钱。

detailed_translations.english: by a great amount
a large amount of something

name: own
trans: belonging to oneself or itself.

sentences.english: Bring your own equipment.
sentences.chinese: 带上你自己的装备。

sentences.english: Every dance has its own rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 每一种舞蹈都有自己的节奏。

sentences.english: The yacht was intended for the King’s own personal use.
sentences.chinese: 这艘游艇是专供国王私用的。

sentences.english: His face was only a few inches from her own.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸离她自己的脸非常近。

sentences.english: The building is owned by the local council.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼归地方议会所有。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing and not any other
to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours

name: great
trans: unusually or comparatively large in size or dimensions; remarkable or outstanding in magnitude, degree, or extent.

sentences.english: The movie was a great success.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片大获成功。

sentences.english: The news came as possibly the greatest shock of my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个消息可能是我一生中最大的打击。

sentences.english: The paintings cost a great deal (= a lot ) of money.
sentences.chinese: 这些画价值不菲。

sentences.english: John always takes great care over his work.
sentences.chinese: 约翰工作时总是非常小心。

sentences.english: It’s a great pity that none of his poems survive.
sentences.chinese: 非常遗憾，他的诗歌没有一首保存下来。

sentences.english: The temptation was too great to resist.
sentences.chinese: 诱惑太大，难以抵挡。

sentences.english: one of the greatest scientific achievements of our time
sentences.chinese: 我们这个时代最伟大的科学成就之一

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount or degree

name: another
trans: used to refer to an additional or different person or thing of the same type as one already mentioned or known about.

sentences.english: They must have returned by another route.
sentences.chinese: 他们肯定是从另一条路线回来的。

detailed_translations.english: not the same thing, person etc, but a different one

name: same
trans: identical; not different or changed.

sentences.english: Her perfume has always had the same effect on me.
sentences.chinese: 她身上的香水给我的感觉一如既往。

sentences.english: He’s the same old Peter – moody and irritable.
sentences.chinese: 他还是以前那个彼得——喜怒无常且爱发火。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相同的；同一的；上述的（通常与the连用）；无变化的
detailed_translations.english: used to say that a particular person or thing does not change

detailed_translations.chinese: 同样的事物或人（通常与the连用）
detailed_translations.english: used to say that two or more people or things are exactly like each other
in the same way

name: few
trans: not many but more than one.

sentences.english: ...spending her few waking hours in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: …把她清醒的个把钟头花在电视机前。

detailed_translations.english: not many or hardly any people or things

name: free
trans: not under the control or in the power of another; able to act or be done as one wishes.

sentences.english: He knew he could be free in as little as three years.
sentences.chinese: 他知道只要再过三年他就能自由了。

sentences.english: With one leap he was free!
sentences.chinese: 这一跳他就自由了！

sentences.english: He walked out of the courtroom a free man .
sentences.chinese: 他从法庭走出来，成了自由人。

sentences.english: They have called on the government to set all political prisoners free .
sentences.chinese: 他们呼吁政府释放所有政治犯。

sentences.english: He was found not guilty and walked free from the court.
sentences.chinese: 他被判无罪，当庭释放。

sentences.english: The animals are allowed to run free in the park.
sentences.chinese: 那些动物可以在公园里自由奔跑。

sentences.english: I’m free next weekend.
sentences.chinese: 下个周末我有空。

detailed_translations.english: not held, tied up, or kept somewhere as a prisoner

name: right
trans: morally good, justified, or acceptable; true or correct as a fact or principle.

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
sentences.chinese: 对，回答正确。

sentences.english: Is that the right time ?
sentences.chinese: 那个时间对吗？

sentences.english: I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
exactly in a particular position or place
used to check if what you have said is correct
exactly in a particular position or place

name: still
trans: not moving or making a sound; continuing to be active or in existence.

sentences.english: I still haven’t finished painting the spare room.
sentences.chinese: 我还没粉刷完那间空房间。

sentences.english: Do you still have Julie’s phone number?
sentences.chinese: 你还留着朱莉的电话号码吗？

detailed_translations.english: up to a particular point in time and continuing at that moment

detailed_translations.chinese: 静止的，不动的；寂静的，平静的；不起泡的
detailed_translations.english: not moving
a photograph of a scene from a film

detailed_translations.chinese: 蒸馏；使…静止；使…平静下来

name: best
trans: of the highest quality or most outstanding type; surpassing all others in excellence, achievement, or quality.

sentences.english: He won the best actor award.
sentences.chinese: 他获得最佳男演员奖。

sentences.english: What’s the best way to cook this fish?
sentences.chinese: 这鱼怎么烧最好？

sentences.english: The best thing to do is to stop worrying.
sentences.chinese: 最好的办法就是不要再担心。

sentences.english: Our pilots are given the best possible training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞行员接受最好的训练。

sentences.english: We use only the very best ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 我们只用最好的原料。

detailed_translations.english: better than anything else or anyone else in quality, skill, how effective it is etc

name: public
trans: of or concerning the people as a whole; done, perceived, or existing in open view.

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

name: human
trans: relating to or characteristic of humankind; having or showing qualities regarded as characteristic of humanity.

sentences.english: There are many different cell types in the human body .
sentences.chinese: 人体中有许多种不同的细胞类型。

sentences.english: the power of the human mind
sentences.chinese: 人脑的威力

sentences.english: The desire for joy lies deep within the human spirit .
sentences.chinese: 对快乐的渴求藏在人类心灵深处。

sentences.english: Infra-red light is invisible to the human eye.
sentences.chinese: 红外线是人眼看不见的。

sentences.english: theories of human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 关于人类行为的理论

sentences.english: different areas of human experience
sentences.chinese: 人类各方面的经验

sentences.english: respect for the absolute value of human life
sentences.chinese: 对人类生命绝对价值的尊重

sentences.english: The accident was the result of human error.
sentences.chinese: 事故是由于人为过失造成的。

sentences.english: The meat was declared unfit for human consumption.
sentences.chinese: 这种肉被宣布不适合人类食用。

sentences.english: Like humans, cats and dogs are omnivores.
sentences.chinese: 和人类一样，猫和狗是杂食性动物。
